content.question: The data table shows the relative rankings of 10 world cities, as reported in the global cities index. The global cities index is scored using the criteria shown, where each category is weighted as to its importance to the overall score. A. Describe the world city concept in the context of globalization. B. Explain the importance of world cities as nodes in the hierarchical diffusion of a globalized culture. C. Explain ONE way the Internet may interrupt the hierarchical diffusion of a globalized culture. D. Explain ONE difference between world cities and metacities. E. Using the data in the table, explain ONE limitation of the world city classification system in reflecting current patterns of global urban development. F. Using the data in the table and the scoring criteria, explain ONE reason for the difference in scores between London and Washington, D.C. G. Explain ONE way economic linkages among world cities may create risks during global financial crises.
